snippet: The finding brings into sharp relief the precariousness of the cleanup at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant, where three of the six reactors suffered core meltdowns.
abstract: Japan’s chief nuclear regulator says stricken nuclear power plant at Fukushima has probably been leaking contaminated water into the ocean for two years, ever since 2011 earthquake and tsunami badly damaged plant; operator Tokyo Electric Power has reported spikes in amounts of radioactive material detected in groundwater at plant, adding urgency to task of sealing leaks.
lead_paragraph: The finding brings into sharp relief the precariousness of the cleanup at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant, where three of the six reactors suffered core meltdowns.

headline.main: Japanese Nuclear Plant May Have Been Leaking for Two Years
headline.print_headline: Japanese Nuclear Plant May Have Been Leaking for Two Years
